{{spoiler}} {{Infobox item |name = Legendary Biter |image = File:XC3 Accessory Pack.png |caption = Accrues Aggro every second. (Extra-major effect.) |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = [[Low Maktha Wildwood]] ([[Cavern of Oblivion]]) |sell = N/A }} The '''Legendary Biter''' is an [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] in {{XC3}}. It can be obtained from a pedestal behind the [[Forgotten Trick Gate]] at the end of the [[Cavern of Oblivion]] in [[Low Maktha Wildwood]], guarded by the [[Dreadwyrm Nizoont]] [[Superboss]]. {{clr}}
== Trivia == * The Legendary Biter looks like the [[Hunter Biter]] used by [[Riki]] in {{XC}}.
== Gallery == <gallery> Legendary Biter Screenshot.jpg|The Legendary Biter </gallery>
{{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Lepus |image = |caption = Lepus |type = [[Levnis]] |tab1 = Rae-Bel Tableland |category = [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level = 24 |area = [[Rae-Bel Tableland]] ([[Old Kana Battlefield]]) |spawntime = Story |respawn = No |detection = |exp = 816 |cp = 72 |sp = 0 |gold = 0 |hp = 469,000 |strength = 477 |healing = 166 |dexterity = 77 |agility = 67 |physdef = -10% |ethdef = 20% |critrate = 10% |guardrate = 0% |tab2 = Erythia Sea |area2 = [[Erythia Sea]] ([[Farlaine Underpass]]) |category2 = [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|Quest Exclusive]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level2 = 55 |spawntime2 = During ''[[Side Story: Taion]]'' |respawn2 = No |movement2 = |detection2 = |exp2 = 1,310 |cp2 = 87 |sp2 = 0 |gold2 = 1,239 |hp2 = 439,950 |strength2 = 751 |healing2 = 351 |dexterity2 = 159 |agility2 = 133 |physdef2 = -10% |ethdef2 = 20% |critrate2 = 10% |guardrate2 = 0% }} '''Lepus''' are [[Boss (XC3)|Bosses]] in {{XC3}}. They are [[Agnus|Agnian]] [[Levnis]]es, and are first fought at level 24 at the [[Old Kana Battlefield]] in [[Rae-Bel Tableland]]. Two are also fought at level 55 at [[Farlaine Underpass]] in [[Erythia Sea]] during ''[[Side Story: Taion]]''. == Battle == === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 50% |knockback = 90% |blowdown = 90% |physdebuff = 0% |etherdebuff = 90% }} === Enraged === Only the Lepus fought at Rae-Bel Tableland will enrage. {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |Boosts damage dealt by 25%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === This Arts list and use conditions correspond to the Rae-Bel Tableland fight. The Erythia Sea Lepus can use all of these Arts at any time, except for Ground Breach, where only the first version with 300% power is used. {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Physical |One Target |1 |200% | | |Anytime |- |'''Knuckle Launcher''' |Physical |One Target |2 |450% |[[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] on both hits |style="text-align:left;"| *Critical Rate is boosted by 50%. *Immune to Knockback and [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] during Art. |Anytime |- |'''Hand Capture''' |Physical |One Target |2 |400% |Grabs target during animation / [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] on release |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 100%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |When reduced to 80% HP |- |'''Fingers of Flame''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |1 |250% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |Anytime |- |rowspan="2"| '''Ground Breach''' |rowspan="2"| Physical |rowspan="2"| AOE on Target |rowspan="2"| 1 | 300% |rowspan="2"| Blowdown |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Immune to all reactions and combos during Art. |When between 30% and 60% HP |- | 250% |style="text-align:left;"|Above notes, plus: *Art is telegraphed by a 10.0s timer, after which it may be used twice in a row. | Once per battle, when reduced to 30% HP |} == Challenge Battle Mode == {{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Lepus |image = |caption = Lepus |type = [[Levnis]] |movement = Ground |area = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |category = [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] |level = 60 |detection = |spawntime = During ''[[Gauntlet: Intermediate]]'' |respawn = No |hp = 922,240 |strength = 2,223 |healing = 762 |dexterity = 244 |agility = 181 |physdef = -10% |ethdef = 20% |critrate = 10% |guardrate = 0% }} A '''Lepus''' is a [[Challenge Battle Enemy (XC3)|Challenge Battle]] [[Boss (XC3)|Boss]] that is fought at level 60 on Stage 30 of the [[Archsage's Gauntlet]] [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge]] ''[[Gauntlet: Intermediate]]''. === Skills === The Lepus has the following skills: * Deals 10% less damage but takes 30% less damage. * Boosts Arts recharge speed by 25%. === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = Immune |knockback = 90% |blowdown = 90% |physdebuff = 70% |etherdebuff = 70% }} === Enraged === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:55%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 50%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 50%. |} {{clr}} === Arts === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:120%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Physical |One Target |1 |200% | | |- |'''Knuckle Launcher''' |Physical |One Target |2 |450% |[[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] on both hits |style="text-align:left;"| *Critical Rate is boosted by 50%. *Immune to Knockback and [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] during Art. |- |'''Hand Capture''' |Physical |One Target |2 |400% |Grabs target during animation / [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] on release |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 100%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |- |'''Fingers of Flame''' |Ether |Frontward AOE |1 |250% | |style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Immune to Knockback and Blowdown during Art. |} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3 Bosses]] [[Category:XC3 Story Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Exclusive Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Quest Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battle Bosses]] [[Category:Fornis Region Enemies]] [[Category:Cadensia Region Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Levnises]] [[Category:XC3 Level 21-25 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 51-55 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Level 56-60 Enemies]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing an infobox image]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing stats]] [[Category:XC3 Enemy pages needing drops]]

revision.comment: added level cap for players and enemies
revision.text:
{{for|other uses|Level}} '''Level''' is a stat in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. It represents a character's or teams' or [[Enemy (XC3)|enemy]]'s overall strength, giving a general indication of how high their other stats are and how well they will do in combat. A character's or teams' level increases as they earn [[Experience Points (XC3)|Experience]] (EXP). The maximum level for party members is 99, and the maximum level for enemies is 200. {{clr}} ==Danger Levels== [[File:XC3 Level Tags.jpg|250px|thumb|Varying colors of level tags of enemies when the party leader is level 50]] On the field, the color of the text showing the enemy's level gives a rough indication of the danger they represent, as measured by the relative difference in the levels of the party leader and the enemy. {| class="xc1 col-2-center" ! Level difference !! Target color |- | Enemy's level is higher by 10 or more | style="background:red; color:white;" | '''Red''' |- | Enemy's level is higher by 5-9 | style="background:yellow;" | '''Yellow''' |- | Enemy's level is within ±4 | style="background:white;" | '''White''' |- | Enemy's level is lower by 5 or more | style="background:gray; color:white;" | '''Gray''' |} == Effects of level differences == Most aggressive enemies (including [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monsters]]) will not attack if the party leader is at least 6 levels higher than the enemy. Notable exceptions include ambushing monsters, as well as generic [[Keves Forces|Kevesi]] and [[Agnus Forces|Agnian forces]], who will attack regardless of level difference. [[Boss (XC3)|Bosses]] and [[Quest Exclusive Enemy (XC3)|quest-exclusive enemies]] also attack regardless of level difference. The difference between a party member's level and an enemy's level affects a number of things in battle: * EXP and CP earned from defeating the enemy, as well as progress earned towards unlocking classes *Damage dealt by the enemy's attacks *Party member's attack accuracy * Enemy's resistance to statuses such as [[Break (XC3)|Break]] and [[Topple (XC3)|Topple]] These effects are applied separately for each party member depending on their individual levels and are summarized in the table below. Not all enemies in the game have these modifiers applied to them: the following enemies do not gain level-dependent modifiers: *All [[Superboss]]es (in {{XC3|-}} only) *Enemies in the following challenge battles of [[Challenge Battle Mode]]: **''[[Primate Triumvirate]]'' **''[[Heroes Frontline]]'' **''[[The Four Devas]]'' **All [[Archsage's Gauntlet]] challenges {| class="xc1 centered" ! ! colspan="3" |Enemy's level is higher ! colspan="4" |Enemy's level is lower |- ! width="10%" |Level difference ! width="20%" |EXP/CP earned, class unlocking progress ! width="10%" | Enemy's damage ! width="10%" |Enemy's resistance ! width="10%" |EXP/CP earned ! width="15%" |Class unlocking progress ! width="10%" |Enemy's damage ! width="15%" |Ally's attack accuracy |- !1 |105%||100%||0%||95%||95%||100% ||110% |- !2 |110% (EXP/CP)
112% (class unlock)||100%|| 0%||86%|| 74%||100%|| 115% |- ! 3 |117% ||105% ||0%||77%||48%||98%||122% |- !4 | 124%||110% ||0%||69%|| 24%||96% || 129% |- ! 5 |134%||125%||0%|| 62%||12%||94%||138% |- !6 |145%||140%|| 0%||56%||0%|| 92%||147% |- !7 |157%||160%||0%||50%||0%||90% ||158% |- !8 |170%|| 180%||0%||45%||0%||88%||169% |- !9 |184%||200%||0%|| 41%||0%||86%||182% |- !10 |200% ||220% ||20% ||37%||0%||84% ||195% |- ! 11 |200%||240%||40%||33%||0%||82%||210% |- ! 12 |200% ||260%||60%||30%||0%||80%||225% |- !13 |200%||280%||80%|| 27%||0%||78%||242% |- ! 14 |200%||300%|| 100%||24%||0%|| 76%||259% |- !15 |200%||320%||100%||22%||0%||74%||278% |- !16 |200%||340%||100%||20%||0%||72%||297% |- !17 |200%||360%||100%||18%||0%||70%||318% |- !18 |200%||380%||100%||16%||0%||68%||339% |- !19 |200%||400%||100%||14%||0%||66%||362% |- !20+ |200%||450%||100%||13%||0%||64%||385% |} == Other effects of level == In the main game only, a party member's level determines the number of [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Master Arts]], [[Skill (XC3)|Master Skills]], [[Gem]]s and [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] that they can equip. Initially, only one of each can be equipped, with the following levels unlocking additional slots: *At level 20, the second Master Art slot and second Gem slot are unlocked, with the third of both unlocking at level 40. *At level 30, the second Master Skill slot and second Accessory slot are unlocked, with the third of both unlocking at level 50. These additional slots are permanent, even if the party member is later leveled down below these thresholds in post-game or [[New Game + (XC3)|New Game+]]. For [[Heroes]], they automatically equip additional gems and accessories once the above level thresholds have been reached. Their level also affects the rating of the gems they equip; at level 1, their gems will be rank I, with their gems ranking up by one tier every 10 levels (11, 21, 31, etc.), except for rank X gems, which are equipped by Heroes starting at level 90 (not 91). A party member's level also determines the strength of their order's completion bonus in a [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attack]], with its effects improving at level 21 and every 20 levels afterwards (41, 61, 81). [[Category:XC3 Battle Flow]] [[Category:XC3FR Battle Flow]] [[Category:XC3 Stats]] [[Category:XC3FR Stats]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |name = Levialord Empireo |image = XC3 Levialord Empireo.png |caption = Levialord Empireo |type = [[Ravoon]] |category = [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] ([[Superboss]]) |level = 110 |area = [[Erythia Sea]] ([[The Aegis Sea]]) |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = Aquatic |exp = 13,828 |cp = 360 |sp = 25 |gold = 8,670 |hp = 12,130,800 |strength = 2,953 |healing = 679 |dexterity = 476 |agility = 323 |physdef = -20% |ethdef = 40% |critrate = 5% |guardrate = 0% }} '''Levialord Empireo''' is a [[Superboss]] in {{XC3}}. It is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] and a member of the [[Ravoon]] family, and can be found at level 110 in [[The Aegis Sea]] in [[Erythia Sea]]. The [[Soulhacker#Enemy Skills|Power Pick-Me-Up]] [[Skill (XC3)|Skill]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] by defeating it. Through re-challenging, Levialord Empireo's level can be increased to a maximum at level 180. == Battle == === Resistances === {{XC3 Resistances |break = 105% |topple = 0% |daze = 0% |burst = 0% |launch = 0% |smash = 0% |knockback = Immune |blowdown = Immune |physdebuff = 75% |etherdebuff = Immune }} {{clr}} === Enraged === {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:70%;" !Trigger |Enemy is reduced to 50% HP. |- !Effects |style="text-align:left;"|Boosts damage dealt by 25%.
Boosts Art recharge speed by 50%.
Shortens durations of debuffs on self by 50%. |} ===Arts=== {|class="xc1 centered" style="width:150%;" !Name !Attribute !Targets !Hits !Power !Reactions/Statuses !Notes !Use Conditions |- |'''''Auto-Attack''''' |Physical |One Target |1 |250% | | |Anytime |- |rowspan="2"|'''Aquatic Impulse''' |rowspan="2"|Ether |rowspan="2"|Frontward AOE |rowspan="2"|1 |220% | [[Shackle Blocking]] |rowspan="2" style="text-align:left;"| *Accuracy is boosted by 50%. *Duration timers of debuffs applied to enemies is extended by 100%. | Anytime during fights up to and including Lv 170 |- | 200% | [[Shackle Healing]] | Anytime during Lv 180 fights; used more frequently while above 90% HP |- |rowspan="2"|'''Oceanic Halo''' |rowspan="2"|Ether |rowspan="2"|AOE around User |rowspan="2"|1 |150% |[[Ether Defense Down (XC3)|Ether Defense Down]] |rowspan="2"| | Anytime during fights up to and including Lv 120 |- |140% |[[Resistance Down]] / Ether Defense Down | Anytime during Lv 125-170 fights; at Lv 180, not used until HP is reduced to 90% |- |rowspan="2"|'''Daedalus Web''' |rowspan="2"|Ether |rowspan="2"|Frontward AOE |1 |180% |rowspan="2"| [[Knockback (XC3)|Knockback]] on all hits | |When reduced to 80% HP during Lv 110 fight |- |2 |170% |style="text-align:left;"| *Removes all buffs from target upon landing a hit. |When reduced to 80% HP during Lv 115-170 fights, or to 90% HP during Lv 180 fight |- |rowspan="3"|'''Arcing Leap''' |rowspan="3"|Physical |rowspan="3"|Frontward AOE |rowspan="3"| 2 | 270% | rowspan="3"| [[Blowdown (XC3)|Blowdown]] on both hits |rowspan="2" style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to all reactions and combos during Art. |When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 110-130 fights |- | rowspan="2"| 185% | When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 135-170 fights, or to 70% HP during Lv 180 fight |- |style="text-align:left;"| *Immune to all reactions and combos during Art. *Has a longer range (40m vs 10m) compared to other versions of the Art, and recharges concurrently with the other version being used. | When reduced to 60% HP during Lv 150-170 fights, or to 70% HP during Lv 180 fight |- |rowspan="2"|'''Lord of the Ocean''' |rowspan="2"|Debuff |rowspan="2"|AOE around User |rowspan="2"| - |rowspan="2"| - |rowspan="2"| [[Shackle Arts]] | |When reduced to 40% HP during Lv 135-170 fights |- |style="text-align:left;"| *Duration timers of debuffs applied to enemies is extended by 50%. |When reduced to 50% HP during Lv 180 fight |- |'''Ocean's Grace''' |Buff |Self | - | - |[[Power Charge]] / [[Accuracy Up (XC3)|Accuracy Up]] | |When reduced to 50% HP during Lv 180 fight |} === Superboss Challenges === After defeating it for the first time, Levialord Empireo can be re-fought at increasing levels by selecting the "Challenge" option on its [[Named Grave]]. After defeating it at a given challenge level, it will appear at the next challenge level the next time it is challenged, until reaching its maximum level. Thus, only the initial Lv 110 version and the final Lv 180 challenge version can be refought. Levialord Empireo has the following stats changed from its base Lv 110 version in each challenge version. Physical and Ether Defense, Critical Rate, Guard Rates and resistances are unchanged in these challenge versions. SP is not dropped from defeating it in a challenge, since the challenge counts as a refight. Lv 115=

Lv 115

{{Spoiler}} [[File:Obliterator Centaurio night.png|thumb|210px|An Agnian Gyrinus Levnis]] '''Levnises''' are machines used for combat by [[Keves]] and [[Agnus]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.
== Overview == [[File:StronghammerDorga.jpg|thumb|210px|A Kevesi Gastrates Levnis]] Kevesi Levnises are usually piloted by a living soldier, while some Agnian Levnises are able to function autonomously. Kevesi Levnises typically operate on the ground and use a black and blue color scheme, while Agnian Levnises are capable of hovering and use a white and green color scheme.
== {{XC3|-}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Auxilia]] * [[Avis]] * [[Centuris]] * [[Equites]] * [[Gastrates]] * [[Sagittarius]] * [[Speculatos]] * [[Testudo]] * [[Velites]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Armadillo]] * [[Automaton Sentry]] * [[Lepus]] * [[Ulula]]
=== Story Exclusive Enemies === * [[Avis Achates]] * [[Gyrinus]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Ambusher Tirion]] (Speculatos) * [[Besieger Sheritt]] (Centuris) * [[Bushwhacker Farritt]] (Ulula) * [[Determined Vatslav]] (Speculatos) * [[Forsaken Arbiter]] (Velites) * [[Infiltrator Garnach]] (Gastrates) * [[Mobile Vespa]] (Equites) * [[Navigator Helios]] (Testudo) * [[Obliterator Centaurio]] (Gyrinus) * [[Protector Revelta]] (Sagittarius) * [[Sensitive Catullus]] (Avis) * [[Taskmaster Imperion]] (Ulula) * [[Thunderclap Dalton]] (Speculatos) * [[Turbulent Martinez]] (Speculatos) * [[Vengeful Dominator]] (Velites)
=== Bosses === * [[Gyrinus]]
=== Quest Exclusive Bosses === * Colony 29 Raiders (During ''[[Knowing Your Family]]''): ** [[Equites (boss)|Equites]] ** [[Velites (boss)|Velites]] * [[Dorrick]] (During ''[[The Final Cog]]'') * [[Evolved Sentry]] (During ''[[Payback for Treason]]'') * [[Ferron Unit]] (During ''[[Inhumanity]]'') * [[Incomplete Siege-Lev]] (During ''[[The Kind Right Hand]]'') * [[Keves Armadillo]] (During ''[[Bearing Fruit]]'') * [[Knoquehardt's Levnis]] (During ''[[Festival of War]]'') * [[Mechapod Carthegia]] (During ''[[A Burning Curiosity, Part 2]]'') * [[Mysterious Raider]] (During ''[[Imminent Illusion]]'', ''[[Severed Connection]]'', ''[[Writer's Block]]'', & ''[[The Illusion Returns]]'') * [[Robobuddy]] (During ''[[Inescapable Past]]'') * [[Segiri#Battle|No. 7]] (During ''[[Inhumanity]]'') * [[No. 13#Battle|No. 13]] (During ''[[Invisible Bond]]'') * [[Rattlejack's Levnis]] (During ''Festival of War'')
=== Challenge Battle Mode Bosses === * [[Segiri#Challenge Battle Mode|No. 7 Segiri]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Auxilia]] * [[Avis]] * [[Centuris]] * [[Equites]] * [[Sagittarius]] * [[Testudo]] * [[Testudo Scout]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Naberius Invictus]] * [[Peacebringer Divalo]] ([[Superboss]]) * [[Perambulator Moritz]] * [[Stronghammer Dorga]] (Superboss)
=== Quest Exclusive Bosses === * [[Patrol Equites]] (During ''[[Regret and Resolve]]'') * [[Prototype Automaton]] (During ''[[The Running Automaton]]'')
== Trivia == * The designs of the Kevesi and Agnian Levnises appear to be based on [[Mechon|Faced Mechon]] and [[Artifice]]s, respectively.

{{Infobox battle art |name = Liberation Edge |image = Liberation Edge.png |who = [[Shulk]] |class = |attribute = |target = One Target |distance = |numhits = |power = |aggro = |knockback = |effect = Increases damage ratio by 100 percentage points and grants Power Charge to all allies. (''FR'')
Increases damage ratio by 50-100 percentage points and grants Power Charge to all allies. (''XC3'') |duration = |recharge = }} '''Liberation Edge''' is a [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Chain Art]] in {{XC3FR|sublink}} and {{XC3}}. It is [[Shulk]]'s Chain Art during a [[Chain Attack (XC3)|Chain Attack]]. {{clr}} {{fr stub}} {{xc3 stub}} [[Category:XC3FR Chain Arts]] [[Category:XC3 Chain Arts]] [[Category:XC3FR Shulk's Arts]]

{{Infobox Gem | name = Lifebearer | image = Gem-healer.png | effect = [Passive] Increases Healing by ''(value)''. | category = Healer | max = 45 }} '''Lifebearer''' is a Healer [[Gem]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. == Gem Stats == {| class="xc1 gem-stats centered" style="width: 200px" ! !Healing Increase |- !I |20 |- !II |22 |- !III |25 |- !IV |27 |- !V |30 |- !VI |33 |- !VII |35 |- !VIII | 37 |- !IX |40 |- !X |45 |} == List of Recipes == At [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]], [[Riku]] will [[Gem Crafting|craft]] [[Gem]]s using items picked up during adventures or acquired from [[enemy (XC3)|enemies]]. If the required items are missing, the party can instead exchange [[Nopon Coin (Gold)|Gold Nopon Coins]] to craft the gem without having to consume any of the required items. === {{XC3|-}} === {| class="xc1 sortable centered" width=100% !Name!!Ingredients!!Rarity!!Coin Cost |- |Lifebearer I |[[Gemstone]]
